smell_analysis.justification: All diagrams in the provided document contain elements and content; no empty diagrams were found.
All use cases in the diagrams (Pages 2 and 3) are connected to actors, either directly or via <<include>> relationships to other use cases that are connected to actors.
No use cases were found that describe the same activity with different names for the same actor.
No instances of multiple model elements with the same name within the same package were found.

The database diagrams (Pages 14-19) utilize Foreign Keys (FK) appropriately to link tables (e.g., 'riik_kood', 'isik_id'). No obvious denormalization or redundant data storage without FKs was detected.

Inconsistent naming conventions are used in the Use Case diagrams (Pages 1 and 2). Some use cases use a 'Verb-Noun' structure (e.g., 'Tuvasta kasutaja', 'Registreeri auto'), while others use a 'Noun' phrase structure (e.g., 'Aktiivsed autod', 'Autode koondaruanne', 'Kõik autod').
In the state diagram (Page 9), all states (Ootel, Aktiivne, Mitteaktiivne, etc.) are reachable from the Start node via defined transitions.
In the activity diagram (Page 4), all actions and decisions are connected in a continuous flow from the Start node to the End node.
Class and database diagrams consistently show multiplicity (e.g., 1, 0..*) or use specific notations (FKs) that imply relationship cardinality. No associations were found lacking these indicators.
No single diagram contains 10 or more central elements. The most populated diagram (Page 15) contains 9 tables.
No single class or table has 6 or more visual connection lines on a single diagram page. The maximum observed was 5 connections for the 'Isik' class on Page 6.
The layout of the diagrams is generally compact and structured, with no related elements placed excessively far apart compared to the average distance.
Several use cases on Page 2 and Page 1 do not start with an active verb. Examples include 'Aktiivsed autod' (Active cars), 'Kõik autod' (All cars), and 'Autode koondaruanne' (Cars summary report).
All class, table, and attribute names analyzed are longer than 3 characters (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto', 'Riik').
Class names start with Uppercase letters and are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto', 'Töötaja').
Attribute and column names consistently start with lowercase letters (e.g., 'eesnimi', 'nimetus', 'isikukood').
Table names in the database diagrams are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto', 'Kasutajakonto').
No improper prefixes (like tbl_, cl_, str) were found on classes, tables, or attributes. Standard allowed prefixes for keys (PK_, FK_) are present.
